The full ingredient list for authorized: 19 vaccines can be found on reputable websites such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the Food and Drug Administration. These ingredients are not harmful and the authorized vaccines do not contain any harmful substances.
The COVID: 19 vaccine trials conducted by Moderna, Pfizer/BioNTech, Novavax, and Johnson & Johnson involved tens of thousands of volunteers who were followed over time to monitor for COVID-19 illness and any adverse reactions. Half of the participants received a placebo, while the other half received the vaccine.
Anti: vaccination activists spread misinformation about the safety, efficacy, and value of COVID-19 vaccines, aiming to undermine people's confidence. However, research and evidence support the safety and effectiveness of COVID-19 vaccines.
While it is not yet known if the authori: 19 vaccines prevent transmission of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, it is likely that they will limit transmission to some degree. Until more is known, it is important for vaccinated individuals to continue wearing masks and practicing physical distancing to prevent potential transmission.
